text: 1) Moses received the Torah from Sinai -- I say, according to the fact that this tractate was not based on the explanation that a commandment from the commandments of the Torah, as are the remaining tractates of the Mishna, rather all ethics and principles, and the sages of the nations of the world, also the author of the books like the ones who fabricated from its core in ethical ways however, men behaved with their friends?, therefore the author began with this tractate Moses received the Torah from Sinai, to say to you that the principles and the ethics that this tractate did not fabricate the sages of the Mishna counter to them, but rather this is what was said at Sinai.
..."In the time to come" [means] in the world to come.

He who learns from every person - even though he is lesser than them, since he is not solicitous of his honor and learns from those who are lesser it is then evident that his pursuit of wisdom is for the glory of God and not for his self-pride and self-glorification
title: Bartenura on Pirkei Avot
